description: Gets information about an evaluation job, such as the status of the job.

parameters.name: jobIdentifier
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the evaluation job you want get information on.

nested_items.name: jobName
nested_items.description: The name for the evaluation job.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The current status of the evaluation job.

nested_items.name: jobArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the evaluation job.

nested_items.name: jobDescription
nested_items.description: The description of the evaluation job.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM service role used in the evaluation job.

nested_items.name: customerEncryptionKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the customer managed encryption key specified when the evaluation job was created.

nested_items.name: jobType
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the evaluation job is automated or human-based.

nested_items.name: applicationType
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the evaluation job is for evaluating a model or evaluating a knowledge base (retrieval and response generation).

nested_items.name: evaluationConfig
nested_items.description: Contains the configuration details of either an automated or human-based evaluation job.

nested_items.name: automated
nested_items.description: Contains the configuration details of an automated evaluation job that computes metrics.

nested_items.name: datasetMetricConfigs
nested_items.description: Configuration details of the prompt datasets and metrics you want to use for your evaluation job.

nested_items.name: taskType
nested_items.description: The the type of task you want to evaluate for your evaluation job. This applies only to model evaluation jobs and is ignored for knowledge base evaluation jobs.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: Used to specify supported built-in prompt datasets. Valid values are Builtin.Bold, Builtin.BoolQ, Builtin.NaturalQuestions, Builtin.Gigaword, Builtin.RealToxicityPrompts, Builtin.TriviaQA, Builtin.T-Rex, Builtin.WomensEcommerceClothingReviews and Builtin.Wikitext2.

nested_items.name: datasetLocation
nested_items.description: For custom prompt datasets, you must specify the location in Amazon S3 where the prompt dataset is saved.

nested_items.name: s3Uri
nested_items.description: The S3 URI of the S3 bucket specified in the job.

nested_items.name: metricNames
nested_items.description: The names of the metrics you want to use for your evaluation job.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: evaluatorModelConfig
nested_items.description: Contains the evaluator model configuration details. EvaluatorModelConfig is required for evaluation jobs that use a knowledge base or in model evaluation job that use a model as judge. This model computes all evaluation related metrics.

nested_items.name: bedrockEvaluatorModels
nested_items.description: The evaluator model used in knowledge base evaluation job or in model evaluation job that use a model as judge. This model computes all evaluation related metrics.

nested_items.name: modelIdentifier
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the evaluator model used used in knowledge base evaluation job or in model evaluation job that use a model as judge.

nested_items.name: customMetricConfig
nested_items.description: Defines the configuration of custom metrics to be used in an evaluation job.

nested_items.name: customMetrics
nested_items.description: Defines a list of custom metrics to be used in an Amazon Bedrock evaluation job.

nested_items.name: customMetricDefinition
nested_items.description: The definition of a custom metric for use in an Amazon Bedrock evaluation job.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name for a custom metric. Names must be unique in your Amazon Web Services region.

nested_items.name: instructions
nested_items.description: The prompt for a custom metric that instructs the evaluator model how to rate the model or RAG source under evaluation.

nested_items.name: ratingScale
nested_items.description: Defines the rating scale to be used for a custom metric. We recommend that you always define a ratings scale when creating a custom metric. If you don't define a scale, Amazon Bedrock won't be able to visually display the results of the evaluation in the console or calculate average values of numerical scores. For more information on specifying a rating scale, see Specifying an output schema (rating scale).

nested_items.name: definition
nested_items.description: Defines the definition for one rating in a custom metric rating scale.

nested_items.name: stringValue
nested_items.description: A string representing the value for a rating in a custom metric rating scale.

nested_items.name: floatValue
nested_items.description: A floating point number representing the value for a rating in a custom metric rating scale.

nested_items.name: evaluatorModelConfig
nested_items.description: Configuration of the evaluator model you want to use to evaluate custom metrics in an Amazon Bedrock evaluation job.

nested_items.name: bedrockEvaluatorModels
nested_items.description: Defines the model you want to evaluate custom metrics in an Amazon Bedrock evaluation job.

nested_items.name: modelIdentifier
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the evaluator model for custom metrics. For a list of supported evaluator models, see Evaluate model performance using another LLM as a judge and Evaluate the performance of RAG sources using Amazon Bedrock evaluations.

nested_items.name: humanWorkflowConfig
nested_items.description: The parameters of the human workflow.

nested_items.name: flowDefinitionArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) for the flow definition.

nested_items.name: instructions
nested_items.description: Instructions for the flow definition.

nested_items.name: customMetrics
nested_items.description: A HumanEvaluationCustomMetric object. It contains the names the metrics, how the metrics are to be evaluated, an optional description.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the metric. Your human evaluators will see this name in the evaluation UI.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: An optional description of the metric. Use this parameter to provide more details about the metric.

nested_items.name: ratingMethod
nested_items.description: Choose how you want your human workers to evaluation your model. Valid values for rating methods are ThumbsUpDown, IndividualLikertScale, ComparisonLikertScale, ComparisonChoice, and ComparisonRank.

nested_items.name: datasetMetricConfigs
nested_items.description: Use to specify the metrics, task, and prompt dataset to be used in your model evaluation job.

nested_items.name: taskType
nested_items.description: The the type of task you want to evaluate for your evaluation job. This applies only to model evaluation jobs and is ignored for knowledge base evaluation jobs.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: Used to specify supported built-in prompt datasets. Valid values are Builtin.Bold, Builtin.BoolQ, Builtin.NaturalQuestions, Builtin.Gigaword, Builtin.RealToxicityPrompts, Builtin.TriviaQA, Builtin.T-Rex, Builtin.WomensEcommerceClothingReviews and Builtin.Wikitext2.

nested_items.name: datasetLocation
nested_items.description: For custom prompt datasets, you must specify the location in Amazon S3 where the prompt dataset is saved.

nested_items.name: s3Uri
nested_items.description: The S3 URI of the S3 bucket specified in the job.

nested_items.name: metricNames
nested_items.description: The names of the metrics you want to use for your evaluation job.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: inferenceConfig
nested_items.description: Contains the configuration details of the inference model used for the evaluation job.

nested_items.name: models
nested_items.description: Specifies the inference models.

nested_items.name: bedrockModel
nested_items.description: Defines the Amazon Bedrock model or inference profile and inference parameters you want used.

nested_items.name: modelIdentifier
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Amazon Bedrock model or inference profile specified.

nested_items.name: inferenceParams
nested_items.description: Each Amazon Bedrock support different inference parameters that change how the model behaves during inference.

nested_items.name: performanceConfig
nested_items.description: Specifies performance settings for the model or inference profile.

nested_items.name: latency
nested_items.description: Specifies whether to use the latency-optimized or standard version of a model or inference profile.

nested_items.name: precomputedInferenceSource
nested_items.description: Defines the model used to generate inference response data for a model evaluation job where you provide your own inference response data.

nested_items.name: inferenceSourceIdentifier
nested_items.description: A label that identifies a model used in a model evaluation job where you provide your own inference response data.

nested_items.name: ragConfigs
nested_items.description: Contains the configuration details of the inference for a knowledge base evaluation job, including either the retrieval only configuration or the retrieval with response generation configuration.

nested_items.name: knowledgeBaseConfig
nested_items.description: Contains configuration details for knowledge base retrieval and response generation.

nested_items.name: retrieveConfig
nested_items.description: Contains configuration details for retrieving information from a knowledge base.

nested_items.name: knowledgeBaseId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the knowledge base.

nested_items.name: knowledgeBaseRetrievalConfiguration
nested_items.description: Contains configuration details for knowledge base retrieval.

nested_items.name: vectorSearchConfiguration
nested_items.description: Contains configuration details for returning the results from the vector search.

nested_items.name: numberOfResults
nested_items.description: The number of text chunks to retrieve; the number of results to return.

nested_items.name: overrideSearchType
nested_items.description: By default, Amazon Bedrock decides a search strategy for you. If you're using an Amazon OpenSearch Serverless vector store that contains a filterable text field, you can specify whether to query the knowledge base with a HYBRID search using both vector embeddings and raw text, or SEMANTIC search using only vector embeddings. For other vector store configurations, only SEMANTIC search is available.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The name of metadata attribute/field, which must match the name in your data source/document metadata.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value of the metadata attribute/field.

nested_items.name: notEquals
nested_items.description: Knowledge base data sources that contain a metadata attribute whose name matches the key and whose value doesn't match the value in this object are returned.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The name of metadata attribute/field, which must match the name in your data source/document metadata.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value of the metadata attribute/field.

nested_items.name: greaterThan
nested_items.description: Knowledge base data sources are returned if they contain a metadata attribute whose name matches the key and whose value is greater than the value in this object.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The name of metadata attribute/field, which must match the name in your data source/document metadata.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value of the metadata attribute/field.

nested_items.name: greaterThanOrEquals
nested_items.description: Knowledge base data sources are returned if they contain a metadata attribute whose name matches the key and whose value is greater than or equal to the value in this object.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The name of metadata attribute/field, which must match the name in your data source/document metadata.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value of the metadata attribute/field.

nested_items.name: value

nested_items.name: lessThanOrEquals
nested_items.description: Knowledge base data sources are returned if they contain a metadata attribute whose name matches the key and whose value is less than or equal to the value in this object.

nested_items.description: The name of metadata attribute/field, which must match the name in your data source/document metadata.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value of the metadata attribute/field.

nested_items.description: The name of metadata attribute/field, which must match the name in your data source/document metadata.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value of the metadata attribute/field.

nested_items.name: startsWith
nested_items.description: Knowledge base data sources are returned if they contain a metadata attribute whose name matches the key and whose value starts with the value in this object. This filter is currently only supported for Amazon OpenSearch Serverless vector stores.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The name of metadata attribute/field, which must match the name in your data source/document metadata.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value of the metadata attribute/field.

nested_items.name: listContains
nested_items.description: Knowledge base data sources are returned if they contain a metadata attribute whose name matches the key and whose value is a list that contains the value as one of its members.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The name of metadata attribute/field, which must match the name in your data source/document metadata.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value of the metadata attribute/field.

nested_items.name: stringContains
nested_items.description: Knowledge base data sources are returned if they contain a metadata attribute whose name matches the key and whose value is one of the following:

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The name of metadata attribute/field, which must match the name in your data source/document metadata.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value of the metadata attribute/field.

nested_items.name: andAll
nested_items.description: Knowledge base data sources are returned if their metadata attributes fulfill all the filter conditions inside this list.

nested_items.name: orAll
nested_items.description: Knowledge base data sources are returned if their metadata attributes fulfill at least one of the filter conditions inside this list.

nested_items.name: retrieveAndGenerateConfig
nested_items.description: Contains configuration details for retrieving information from a knowledge base and generating responses.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of resource that contains your data for retrieving information and generating responses.

nested_items.name: knowledgeBaseConfiguration
nested_items.description: Contains configuration details for the knowledge base retrieval and response generation.

nested_items.name: knowledgeBaseId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the knowledge base.

nested_items.name: modelArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the foundation model or inference profile used to generate responses.

nested_items.name: retrievalConfiguration
nested_items.description: Contains configuration details for retrieving text chunks.

nested_items.name: vectorSearchConfiguration
nested_items.description: Contains configuration details for returning the results from the vector search.

nested_items.name: numberOfResults
nested_items.description: The number of text chunks to retrieve; the number of results to return.

For other vector store configurations, only SEMANTIC search is available.

nested_items.name: generationConfiguration
nested_items.description: Contains configurations details for response generation based on retrieved text chunks.

nested_items.name: promptTemplate
nested_items.description: Contains the template for the prompt that's sent to the model for response generation.

nested_items.name: textPromptTemplate
nested_items.description: The template for the prompt that's sent to the model for response generation. You can include prompt placeholders, which become replaced before the prompt is sent to the model to provide instructions and context to the model. In addition, you can include XML tags to delineate meaningful sections of the prompt template.

nested_items.name: guardrailConfiguration
nested_items.description: Contains configuration details for the guardrail.

nested_items.name: guardrailId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the guardrail.

nested_items.name: guardrailVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the guardrail.

nested_items.name: kbInferenceConfig
nested_items.description: Contains configuration details for inference for knowledge base retrieval and response generation.

nested_items.name: textInferenceConfig
nested_items.description: Contains configuration details for text generation using a language model via the RetrieveAndGenerate function.

nested_items.name: temperature
nested_items.description: Controls the random-ness of text generated by the language model, influencing how much the model sticks to the most predictable next words versus exploring more surprising options. A lower temperature value (e.g. 0.2 or 0.3) makes model outputs more deterministic or predictable, while a higher temperature (e.g. 0.8 or 0.9) makes the outputs more creative or unpredictable.

nested_items.name: topP
nested_items.description: A probability distribution threshold which controls what the model considers for the set of possible next tokens. The model will only consider the top p% of the probability distribution when generating the next token.

nested_items.name: maxTokens
nested_items.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the output text. Do not use the minimum of 0 or the maximum of 65536. The limit values described here are arbitrary values, for actual values consult the limits defined by your specific model.

nested_items.name: stopSequences
nested_items.description: A list of sequences of characters that, if generated, will cause the model to stop generating further tokens. Do not use a minimum length of 1 or a maximum length of 1000. The limit values described here are arbitrary values, for actual values consult the limits defined by your specific model.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: additionalModelRequestFields
nested_items.description: Additional model parameters and corresponding values not included in the textInferenceConfig structure for a knowledge base. This allows you to provide custom model parameters specific to the language model being used.
(string) ---
(document) ---

nested_items.name: orchestrationConfiguration
nested_items.description: Contains configuration details for the model to process the prompt prior to retrieval and response generation.

nested_items.name: queryTransformationConfiguration
nested_items.description: Contains configuration details for transforming the prompt.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of transformation to apply to the prompt.

nested_items.name: externalSourcesConfiguration
nested_items.description: The configuration for the external source wrapper object in the retrieveAndGenerate function.

nested_items.name: modelArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the foundation model or inference profile used to generate responses.

nested_items.name: sources
nested_items.description: The document for the external source wrapper object in the retrieveAndGenerate function.

nested_items.name: sourceType
nested_items.description: The source type of the external source wrapper object.

nested_items.name: s3Location
nested_items.description: The S3 location of the external source wrapper object.

nested_items.name: uri
nested_items.description: The S3 URI location for the wrapper object of the document.

nested_items.name: byteContent
nested_items.description: The identifier, content type, and data of the external source wrapper object.

nested_items.name: identifier
nested_items.description: The file name of the document contained in the wrapper object.

nested_items.name: contentType
nested_items.description: The MIME type of the document contained in the wrapper object.

nested_items.name: data
nested_items.description: The byte value of the file to upload, encoded as a Base-64 string.

nested_items.name: generationConfiguration
nested_items.description: Contains configurations details for response generation based on retrieved text chunks.

nested_items.name: promptTemplate
nested_items.description: Contains the template for the prompt for the external source wrapper object.

nested_items.name: textPromptTemplate
nested_items.description: The template for the prompt that's sent to the model for response generation. You can include prompt placeholders, which become replaced before the prompt is sent to the model to provide instructions and context to the model. In addition, you can include XML tags to delineate meaningful sections of the prompt template.

nested_items.name: guardrailConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration details for the guardrail.

nested_items.name: guardrailId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the guardrail.

nested_items.name: guardrailVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the guardrail.

nested_items.name: kbInferenceConfig
nested_items.description: Configuration details for inference when using RetrieveAndGenerate to generate responses while using an external source.

nested_items.name: textInferenceConfig
nested_items.description: Contains configuration details for text generation using a language model via the RetrieveAndGenerate function.

nested_items.name: temperature
nested_items.description: Controls the random-ness of text generated by the language model, influencing how much the model sticks to the most predictable next words versus exploring more surprising options. A lower temperature value (e.g. 0.2 or 0.3) makes model outputs more deterministic or predictable, while a higher temperature (e.g. 0.8 or 0.9) makes the outputs more creative or unpredictable.

nested_items.name: topP
nested_items.description: A probability distribution threshold which controls what the model considers for the set of possible next tokens. The model will only consider the top p% of the probability distribution when generating the next token.

nested_items.name: maxTokens
nested_items.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the output text. Do not use the minimum of 0 or the maximum of 65536. The limit values described here are arbitrary values, for actual values consult the limits defined by your specific model.

nested_items.name: stopSequences
nested_items.description: A list of sequences of characters that, if generated, will cause the model to stop generating further tokens. Do not use a minimum length of 1 or a maximum length of 1000. The limit values described here are arbitrary values, for actual values consult the limits defined by your specific model.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: additionalModelRequestFields
nested_items.description: Additional model parameters and their corresponding values not included in the text inference configuration for an external source. Takes in custom model parameters specific to the language model being used.
(string) ---
(document) ---

nested_items.name: precomputedRagSourceConfig
nested_items.description: Contains configuration details about the RAG source used to generate inference response data for a Knowledge Base evaluation job.

nested_items.name: retrieveSourceConfig
nested_items.description: A summary of a RAG source used for a retrieve-only Knowledge Base evaluation job where you provide your own inference response data.

nested_items.name: ragSourceIdentifier
nested_items.description: A label that identifies the RAG source used for a retrieve-only Knowledge Base evaluation job where you provide your own inference response data.

nested_items.name: retrieveAndGenerateSourceConfig
nested_items.description: A summary of a RAG source used for a retrieve-and-generate Knowledge Base evaluation job where you provide your own inference response data.

nested_items.name: ragSourceIdentifier
nested_items.description: A label that identifies the RAG source used for a retrieve-and-generate Knowledge Base evaluation job where you provide your own inference response data.

nested_items.name: outputDataConfig
nested_items.description: Contains the configuration details of the Amazon S3 bucket for storing the results of the evaluation job.

nested_items.name: s3Uri
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 URI where the results of the evaluation job are saved.

nested_items.name: creationTime
nested_items.description: The time the evaluation job was created.

nested_items.name: lastModifiedTime
nested_items.description: The time the evaluation job was last modified.

nested_items.name: failureMessages
nested_items.description: A list of strings that specify why the evaluation job failed to create.
(string) ---
